casebody.data:
Stanmore Cawthon COOPER, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. FEDERAL AVIATION ADMINISTRATION; Social Security Administration; U.S. Department of Transportation, Defendants-Appellees. No. 08-17074. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. Oct. 4, 2012. Raymond A. Cardozo, Tiffany Renee Thomas, Reed Smith LLP, San Francisco, CA, James M. Wood, Reed Smith, LLP, Oakland, CA, David J. Bird, Reed Smith LLP, Pittsburgh, PA, for Plaintiff-Appellant. Michael Thomas Pyle, Assistant U.S. Attorney, Jennifer S. Wang, Assistant U.S. Attorney, Office of the U.S. Attorney, San Francisco, CA, Samantha Lee Chaifetz, Mark B. Stern, U.S. Department of Justice, Washington, DC, for Defendants-Appellees.

On Remand from the Supreme Court of the United States. D.C. No. 3:07-cv-01383-VRW.

Before: MYRON H. BRIGHT,* MICHAEL DALY HAWKINS, and MILAN D. SMITH, JR., Circuit Judges.

The Honorable Myron H. Bright, Senior Circuit Judge for the Eighth Circuit, sitting by designation.

ORDER

In accordance with the mandate of the Supreme Court in FAA v. Cooper, — U.S. -, 132 S.Ct. 1441, 182 L.Ed.2d 497 *1266(2012), the judgment of the district court is affirmed.
